alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 10:16AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and west central Arizona, including the following counties, in southwest Arizona, Yuma. In west central Arizona, La Paz. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including water over some area roadways. This includes Highway 95 from Quartzsite to Yuma and Highway 72 from Vicksburg to Parker in central La Paz County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1009 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated steady light to moderate rain over the past several hours with rainfall rates over half an inch per hour in some areas. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area through early afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parker, Quartzsite, Kofa Wildlife Refuge, Brenda, Vicksburg Junction, Vicksburg, Harcuvar, Bouse, Salome, Wenden, Yuma Proving Ground, Palm Canyon, Ehrenberg and Poston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
